author: jwasinger
content:
I have been working on a new proposal and I think now is a good time to raise awareness here and solicit for feedback from the community.

EIP-5843 - EVM Modular Arithmetic Extensions (shortened to EVMMAX) is a proposal to add efficient modular addition/subtraction/multiplication opcodes to the EVM. it can enable an array of desired operations (such as BLS12381 curve operations from EIP-2537) to be implemented as EVM contracts.

The EthMagicians EIP thread (https://ethereum-magicians.org/t/eip-5843-evm-modular-arithmetic-extensions/12425) gives a high-level overview and provides links to several resources:
* a benchmarking document
* an analysis and benchmarks of a BLS12381 G1 point multiplication EVM implementation. It contains comparisons against equivalent native implementations
* a fork of the Huff language compiler modified to support the new opcodes

author: chfast
content: It looks like awesome piece of work. Have you tried to implement one of the existing EC precompiles, e.g. bn128 ADD?

author: jwasinger
content: thank you.  for EC ops, I have only implemented bls12381 g1 add and mul using the basic double-and-add algorithm.

author: axic3354
content:
I spent a bit of time reviewing the point evaluation precompile of EIP-4844 to understand its requirements and edge cases, and also tried to reimplement it using EIP-2537.

There are some notes I wrote down while doing so: https://notes.ethereum.org/@axic/HJ6k_Nlis

This lists a number of questions and initial conclusions, as well as points to some prototype source code at https://github.com/axic/4844-contracts

Is anyone in the 4844 implementer groups focusing on the precompile currently?
